name: The Ritz-Carlton New Orleans

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Ritz Carlton March 26-27th. On the evening of the 27th half of the French Quarter lost electricity due to a transformer fire (not the Ritz's fault or under their control). The Ritz was incredibly accomodating to this problem.
reviews.title: Incredibly Accomodating During Frustrating Time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The provided free sodas and water throughout the hotel; had backup generators running the elevators and hallway lights; provided as many flashlights and glowsticks as you needed; and of course did not charge you if you decided to spend the night when they didn't have electricity.
reviews.title: Great 40th B-day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was incredibly impressed with their preparation for an "event" such as this.
reviews.title: What you expect from the Ritz!
Ants Everywhere!
reviews.text: I was treated like royalty by each and every member of the club floor staff!! Best bloody mary I have ever had. Food and wine presentations were excellent.

The hotel is beautiful with large, elegant rooms and gorgeous bathrooms in white marble with yummy Bvlgari products. The gym was spacious with state of the art equipment. The hotel location is right in the middle of the city on Canal and the courtyard is very cute and cozy! Would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Best Hotel Ever!

reviews.text: Mixed review for his hotel I'm afraid.
reviews.title: Below par for Ritz Carlton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a busy hotel on the edge of the French Quarter. The rooms were decorated to Ritz Carlton standard, everything worked, and was to a high standard. We arrived at 6pm on Friday by car, valet parking and check in was very efficient, we were in our room within 20 mins. No problems with the room or room service. So the hotel ticks most boxes.
reviews.title: Not sure what everyone is complaining about

reviews.text: Breakfast on Saturday morning was disappointment. Only half the dining room was in use, and we had to wait 30 mins for a table. Not acceptable in a hotel of this standard. A number of other guess were very annoyed by this, and with a few more staff it could easily be avoided. I would not stay here again for that reason, in other respects it was a reasonable hotel.
reviews.title: Never use a debit card at this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't help but think that the people who posted the review right before this one stayed at a different property. I was just there last weekend and thought that everything was spectacular - from the room to the room service to the staff overall.
reviews.title: Ruined our vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will definitely stay there again on future trips to New Orleans!
reviews.title: A perfect romantic get-away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a bad stay at another hotel we switched to the Ritz Carlton New Orleans and loved it! We were traveling with our small dog and the Ritz Carlton chain is pet friendly with a $150 nonrefundable fee. We've never been to a Ritz Carlton before so we had no preconceived notion of what to expect.
reviews.title: Amazing Top Quality Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is all valet at about $36 per day. The hotel was easy to find. We loaded our bags on to a cart but a valet parked the car and a bellhop brought our bags to the room in a timely manner (about 10-15 minutes). Check-in was very fast and the lobby smells wonderful with these amazing candles. We bought 2 in the gift shop prior to our departure ($24 each). Everyone fussed over our little dog. When we got to our room, the housekeeping was already doing the turn-down service. The turn-down service consists of a mini bottled water with a glass, removal of the cover throw and accent pillows, turning down the bed sheets, and 2 chocolates. Our room was on the interior side which I liked based on previous reviews about road noise. We only had 1 wall that attached to another room so it was extremely quiet. Probably the most quiet hotel I've ever been to. We were in search of a good comforter and liked theirs so much that we purchased it!
reviews.title: Classy Establishment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited the concierge multiple times throughout the trip and he was extremely helpful with finding excellent restaurants. One day when we had some time to kill, he sent us to the WWII museum. We ate at the Ritz restaurant one night. For an upscale restaurant, I'd give it 4 out of 5 stars. The location is great, 2 blocks to Bourbon Street and 1 mile to Cafe du Monde.
reviews.title: Had a wonderful stay!

reviews.text: My fiance visited the spa and received the Magnolia scrub and a facial ($150 each). It was a little too expensive for my taste but I was amazed by the large selection of choices. He loved the Magnolia scrub but didn't enjoy the facial. Not that it wasn't good, just not something he was in to.
reviews.title: Probaby the best hotel in New Orleans

reviews.text: Overall, it's a great hotel and we're already planning on weekend trips to this hotel.
reviews.title: oasis amid New Orleans

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most people who stay at a Ritz Carlton property fall into one of two camps:
reviews.title: Solid 4-Star, But Not Five. NOT What a Ritz-Carlton Should Be.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Camp 1: There is NOTHING the hotel can do wrong. These people are so blown away by the name on the door and the lion logo on the bath mat that everything is just perfect, no matter what.
reviews.title: NIcve hotel, with a nice location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Camp 2: There is NOTHING the hotel can do right. These people nitpick the tiniest details, demand utter perfection, pitch fits, complain, and won't settle for anything less than the warped idea of luxury that resides only in their own minds.
reviews.title: Classy elegancy in a middle of histroic city

reviews.text: We don't fall into either of those groups.
reviews.title: Great hotel for a long weekend break in New Orleans

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rather, we're totally reasonable people who travel three or four times a year, purely for enjoyment, and stay in 4, 4.5, and 5-star establishments. We have definite reasonable expectations, preferring not to complain, but willing to do so if something's really amiss.
reviews.title: Very nearly Perfect, Spring for Club Level
